result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J Pugh Jr

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Joshua J Pugh Jr in court.  Attorney Timothy T. Kay in court for Joshua J Pugh Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for a response from the charging DA on the last offer.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:13 AM Defendant Joshua J Pugh in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 09:06 AM Defendant Joshua J Pugh in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The defendant is provided a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Court takes a short recess at 9:08 AM.  Matter recalled at 9:14 AM with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
